    • Method Detail

      • getShortArrayByteSize

        public static int getShortArrayByteSize(ByteBuffer bb)
        Get size of array. An array is stored with a four bytes length indicator at the beginning of the byte buffer. The byte size of a short array is therefore 4 + length*2.

        This method does not change the ByteBuffer position.

        Parameters:
        bb - a ByteBuffer value
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • getShortArrayByteSize

        public static int getShortArrayByteSize(short[] array)
        Get size of array. An array is stored with a four bytes length indicator at the beginning of the byte buffer. The byte size of a short array is therefore 4 + length*2.

        Parameters:
        array - the array
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • putShortArray

        public static void putShortArray(ByteBuffer bb,
                                 short[] array)
        Store an array of shorts in a byte buffer. Moves the byte buffer pointer.
        Parameters:
        bb - the buffer used for storage
        array - the array to store

      • getIntArrayByteSize

        public static int getIntArrayByteSize(ByteBuffer bb)
        Get size of array. An array is stored with a four bytes length indicator at the beginning of the byte buffer. The byte size of an integer array is therefore 4 + length*4.

        This method does not change the ByteBuffer position.

        Parameters:
        bb - a ByteBuffer value
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • getDoubleArrayByteSize

        public static int getDoubleArrayByteSize(ByteBuffer bb)
        Get size of array. An array is stored with a four bytes length indicator at the beginning of the byte buffer. The byte size of a double array is therefore 4 + length*8.

        This method does not change the ByteBuffer position.

        Parameters:
        bb - a ByteBuffer value
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • getByteStorableArrayByteSize

        public static int getByteStorableArrayByteSize(ByteBuffer bb)
        Get size of ByteStorable array. An array is stored with the number of bytes total in first four bytes. Then comes a four bytes length indicator, then the array itself. This method does not change the ByteBuffer position.
        Parameters:
        bb - a ByteBuffer value
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • getByteStorableArrayByteSize

        public static int getByteStorableArrayByteSize(BStorable<?,?>[] array)
        Get size of ByteStorable array. An array is stored with the number of bytes total in first four bytes. Then comes a four bytes length indicator, then the array itself.
        Parameters:
        array - the array
        Returns:
        the size (in bytes) of the array, including the four bytes for the size indicator

      • getByteStorableArray

        public static <A,B extends BStorable<A,B>> BStorable<A,B>[] getByteStorableArray(ByteBuffer bb,
                                                                                 BStorable<A,B>[] arrayTemplate,
                                                                                 BStorable<A,B> template)
        Get an array of ByteStorables from a byte buffer. Moves the byte buffer pointer
        Type Parameters:
        A - wrapped BComparable class
        B - BComparabble class
        Parameters:
        bb - the byte buffer containing the buffer
        arrayTemplate - the template for the specific ByteStorable
        template - the template for the specific ByteStorable
        Returns:
        an array of ByteStorables
